scheme_name: Subsidy Scheme on Establishment of 25 R.I.R. Bird’s Unit, 100 Broiler Bird’s Unit and Stipend for Poultry Farming Training for Scheduled Caste People
details: The scheme aims to support Scheduled Caste individuals by providing financial assistance for poultry farming.
objective: To promote self-employment and economic upliftment among Scheduled Caste individuals.
benefits: 75% subsidy (up to ₹6,000/-) for establishing a 25 R.I.R. bird unit (benefit provided in kind).
90% subsidy (up to ₹36,000/-) for setting up a 100-broiler bird unit (amount transferred via RTGS/NEFT).
₹2,000/- stipend for completing poultry farming training.
eligibility: The applicant must be residing in Gujarat.
The applicant must be a Scheduled Caste individual.
The applicant must be an adult (18 years or above).
The applicant must have completed a 6-day poultry farming training.
application_process: Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Animal Husbandry Schemes’.
Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.
Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.
Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.
Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.
Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application and submit Related Documents through to concern Taluka office.
documents_required: Residential proof (Aadhaar Card, Ration Card, etc.)
Training completion certificate (6-day poultry rearing training)
